TopicTitle: Why do you never visit Dres?

Articles.Content:
> 
> I like dres it just is tiny

Thats why i liked it too. Dres is smaller than Ike but its own Planet ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Seven years? Nasa don't use time warp?

They did use timewarp. Didn't the last seven years seem a bit fast to you? My timewarp-aware watch said it was all of twenty minutes of real time.

I visited Dres once back in 0.23.5. Kerbal alarm clock said there was a window so why not? Modified my Duna+Ike remote tech satellite mission (2 satellites + lander per body) by basically replacing duna part with more fuel. It was the sloppiest mission ever, didn't bother checking any delta-v budgets or anything. Probably why it almost failed. Had to transfer all fuel from one satellite and half the fuel of the lander to one satellite and ditch the other to squeeze more delta-v out. So managed to get the long range communications satellite in orbit, but the lander fell 30m/s short of making a controlled landing. Lost all solar panels with basically very little electricity left. It managed to transmit half a temperature scan before dying.

The real question always was why would you visit Dres twice? And it seems with 1.0 we have a reason.

> 
> I visited Dres once back in 0.23.5. Kerbal alarm clock said there was a window so why not? Modified my Duna+Ike remote tech satellite mission (2 satellites + lander per body) by basically replacing duna part with more fuel. It was the sloppiest mission ever, didn't bother checking any delta-v budgets or anything. Probably why it almost failed. Had to transfer all fuel from one satellite and half the fuel of the lander to one satellite and ditch the other to squeeze more delta-v out. So managed to get the long range communications satellite in orbit, but the lander fell 30m/s short of making a controlled landing. Lost all solar panels with basically very little electricity left. It managed to transmit half a temperature scan before dying.
> The real question always was why would you visit Dres twice? And it seems with 1.0 we have a reason.

the low gravity would make it a good gas station ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I now visit Dres regularly as a refuelling point for Jool bound ships which no longer have the ability to make the trip themselves. It was close between it and Duna but Duna has a higher escape velocity and doesn't have orbital sources of fuel available.

"Explore Dres"

- done

that video is creepy oO
Because dres doesn't exist. :3

#ThisThreadSux

#JustSayin

Am I the only one that keeps forgetting about Dres? Sometimes when i'm in the tracking station I think to myself "Wait, what the heck is that rock between Duna and Jool?" and then after looking at it i'm like oh its you Dres!

Dres is awesome!

i agree with spaceplane, #ThisThreadSux 

dres awareness instead! show your love not hate for the lonely space potato!

Wrong, not horribly wrong, but Dres is slightly bigger than Ike.

Parameter\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_Ike\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_Dres

Mas (x10^20)\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_2.78\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_3.22

Radius (km)\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_130\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_138

Surface areea (x10^21 m2)\_\_\_2.12\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_2.39

Surface gravity (m/s2)\_\_\_\_\_\_\_1.10\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_1.13

MISSION TO DRES!

I built my first (in this career) interplanetay cruiser and ts just my next holmann window.  I'm sending a crew of 5, 3 landers, a roverbot (that will stay there)  labs, the whole sha-bang!

**Edited <time datetime="2016-03-21T11:14:25Z" title="03/21/2016 11:14  AM" data-short="8 yr">March 21, 2016</time> by Brainlord Mesomorph**

Its best feature is the canyon, and maybe a few craters. Aside from that, it is (As mentioned by others before) just like the Mun and Ike, but with no nice planet to look at.

Edit: I guess you can use it as a service station on the way to more interesting destinations if you want.
For Dres!

So, people hate Dres. I was going to visit NEVER but I have changed my mind. So much hate for little Dres.

[@Phil deCube](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/120897-phil-decube/) is the only cool one here... EVEN IF he is Australian....

QUESTION: Why do Aussies drink tea out of saucers.... because us Kiwi's keep winning all their cups.... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

But he is STILL cool. With my hip still hurting and play time limited, I have decided the least I can do NOW is to send a probe to Dres so orbit it.... it will be like I am giving it a celestial hug...

I'll do that next time I partake this adventure game. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
Well, I've given it as much attention as most of the other bodies.  And I plan to keep it that way.

Dres is awesome! If you like rovers, Dres is the place! It is like Ike, but instead of loooong smooth inclines, it's all kind of bumpy, so you bounce and rattle up and down hill. Best driving in the system, without exception. 

Dres! Dres! Dres! Visit Dres!

![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
